website_summaries.verdict: A great one to consider if you want a larger bin, but it is expensive and uses specialized filters.
pros: Easy cleanup and 1.5-gallon size means it's larger than most competing compost bins

customer_reviews.title: Wifey likes it, so I like it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good bit bigger than our previous and she says that makes it easier to get stuff in the can. I like that I don't have to dump it in the compost tumbler as often. No smell thanks to the carbon filter (included). It's well made and attractive on the counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: The MOST perfect container for our needs
customer_reviews.text: This compost pail is exactly what is/was needed to suit our needs. The design is functional as well as beautiful. The size is most ideal for use and is MUCH more convenient than the taller but narrower designs offered by others. The cover fits perfectly and allows for use of a plastic bag and still be able to seal well and not pinch off or damage the bag. Our friends saw this at a distance and WOW what a great container. Got to get one of those, she said. Never-the-less the container suits our needs to greater expectations. Suggest that anyone looking for a product like this to compost or just hold your table/food preparations should definitely purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Good investment!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this container for two weeks and love it. It holds a lot of scraps. The handle is very sturdy. The filters really work to keep gnats out. The lid is also secure but easy to open. I know it’s a pot with a lid...but it’s far superior than the bowl with a not secure lid I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Nona Evans

customer_reviews.title: So far, WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: This container is great! We've had two ceramic ones and the handles have come off at bad times causing them to hit the ground and shatter. This is extra big, but not too big and is very well built. We've just gotten it so we will be watching for loose screws as mentioned in other reviews, but hey, tightening a screw now and then beats sweeping up the broken ceramic pieces and compost off the floor. It looks great on the counter and the lid fits nicely, plus it will hold plenty of compostable material before it needs to go to the compost pile. We like it!
customer_reviews.author: Frog1369

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pail to Pitch your Peelings.
customer_reviews.text: Been composting for years and even with containers with close fitting lids the smell was obvious when you opened the undersink cabinet. Probably because I always used a plastic container. This unit not only looks nice, it cleans soooo easily and I swear, it even smells better with the lid off than the old plastic one smelled when sealed. Definitely a recommend!
customer_reviews.author: pa-c man

customer_reviews.title: good, so far
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a month, and so far it is working great. I had an ice cream bucket before. This looks so much better and my family likes that the cover comes off more easily than the ice cream bucket lid. The filters work great--no odor. No rust so far. It holds a lot of waste and worked great for me to carry it out to the compost bin and then rinse it when I came back in (to get the gooey stuff at the bottom that didn't come out when I dumped it).
customer_reviews.author: scout

customer_reviews.title: Perfect countertop compost holder
customer_reviews.text: I save my banana peels and use them for my rose bushes. I needed some sort of "in-kitchen" container to collect the peels until I can move them outside. This counter top compost container does the perfect job. It looks good in the kitchen, it is completely odor-free, and it holds a good amount of material so that it doesn't need constant emptying. Oh -- and unlike the other containers I tried, no bugs get into this one. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tobin Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Compost Needs and pretty to Boot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the pail via Amazon over a year ago and I love having it around. I decided to splurge on the stainless steel really for the aesthetic quality, but I can see now it makes clean up much easier. I can be very bad about remembering to take my pail contents out to my compost bin - but the pail does a great job preventing odors to seep out. I can say this without hesitation as I've gone four weeks without dumping it. It's very easy to clean - I just use water and soap - and the charcoal inserts work well. Over all I'm thrilled with my garden purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sojourner8

customer_reviews.title: Works well and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this compost bucket to replace a plastic coffee can we had been using. The filter works wonderful and no smells come through even after several days. This large size allows for a wide mouth opening so no spillage if you are trying to clean off your plates. The finish is very nice and it is very attractive looking sitting on the counter. I would recommend this 1.5 gallon size.
customer_reviews.author: Keystone View

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to buy
customer_reviews.text: This size is perfect so I don't have to empty it daily. I am a veggie person and juice, so I have lots to compost. It is nice looking and am very happy with it. I use their composting bags with it so I don't have to go outside to wash it out. Their compost bags are GMO free. It is made solid and the filter does the trick. No smell.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Can’t find bags that fit. Either way too small or way too big
customer_reviews.text: Can’t find bags that fit. Either way too small or way too big. I guess that’s why it comes with extra filters but no bags. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice! Charcoal filter means no smell whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! Charcoal filter means no smell whatsoever. Filter also means the gases can escape so the compost doesn't begin to ferment or rot. Stainless steel makes it easy to clean. Unlike plastic, it won't scratch and retain smell and food fragments. Handle makes it easy to carry with no spilling or slipping. It's also pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Iron chef

customer_reviews.title: perfect counter compost pail
customer_reviews.text: This is big enough to hold quite a bit of compost, but not so big that it eats lots of counter space. (There are two of us, and we've let it go several days sometimes.) The stainless steel is heavy-duty, and satin-y enough to go w/ either polished or brushed s.s. kitchen fixtures. So far, there has been zero odor from it, even though it's been quite warm. SOOO much nicer than emptying the garbage bowl after every meal!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous 1

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: This a nice product. I have never composted before, and having something that blended into my kitchen and was easy to use, was a helpful start. I am glad I found it on this site, because I almost bought it somewhere else for $20 more.
customer_reviews.author: T. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I've shopped around for a good, sturdy compost bin and this one is the best one that I've come across. Other compost pails tended to have lids that seemed to get stuck when I took the lids off but this compost pail is not flimsy or cheap looking like the other ones I've seen. The stainless steel is really nice too. It adds a nice touch in touch to the kitchen and really easy to wash when needed. A little more on the pricey side but I think it's worth spending the money and receiving a good product than saving around $10 for a cheaper version of this pail.
customer_reviews.author: minish

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Pail
customer_reviews.text: Now we have a place to put all are leftover vegies and scrap kitchen trimmings. Best of all it gives it give off no smell. All this kitchen compost goes into my large out door compost bins and is eventually recycled to our Garden.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene F. White

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We have been composting for about 15 years and always used plastic pails and the container would take on the bad odor of rotting food over a period of time. This container is ideal as the stainless steel does not hold any odors and cleaning it is super easy. The filter alows the compost to receive air and start the breaking down process but trully traps all smells inside the container. Last, the size is great at 1.5 gallons. The 1.0 gallon containers on the market would not have been large enough.
customer_reviews.author: Running Bigs

customer_reviews.title: The only good way to keep garbage on your counter
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot, easy to clean. Has that modern stainless chic look. Doesn't stink. How else are you going to keep garbage attractively on your counter? A little spendy, but it is heavy duty and should actually last for thousands of years. Compost is a good thing in several ways and this is a good way to collect it. Looks good on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Carlgo

customer_reviews.title: We use this daily and it looks good on my countertop
customer_reviews.text: We use this daily and it looks good on my countertop, The clean up has been easy and it is maintaining it shiny exterior. I have had many other containers and love this one!
customer_reviews.author: JHW

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This bucket have lived up to all the claims I really love it for holding my kitchen scraps until I can put in compost. There is never any odor and it is very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: AWoo10

customer_reviews.title: Composting made a little easier
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased our second one so that we can run the first thru the dishwasher and still have one to use. Durable and fits in the dishwasher. Can't see much wrong with this product except the high price! But I think you get what you pay for so I think it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Clara Burger

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to help me with my outside composting. I found that I was running outside all of the time to add "garbage" to my pile. This product has reduced the number of trips outside to once per week! And I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cinderella

customer_reviews.title: Rusted
customer_reviews.text: Used less than a month and this stainless steel? compost pail rusted inside. Now using a plastic insert. Not how envisioned using this product. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Arrietta Green

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great product!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on this item and purchased it based on what I read. I have had it for over a month now, I believe and am very satisfied with it! I don't smell a thing, due to the double charcoal filters and it holds quite a bit of trimmings. It is attractive and doesn't take up too much space on the countertop. Great value for the price, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a compost pail!
customer_reviews.author: Eliana Martinez

customer_reviews.title: named it "Silver".
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love this. No odor and it looks good sitting on the counter
customer_reviews.author: hackfoo

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter. She absolutely loves it. The filters work so well and being vegan she finds that she can fill it up pretty fast. She does compost and has a garden so it will definitely be the most prized kitchen gadget she owns. She doesn't know how she got along without it. I have a gallon one and thinking about purchasing this size for myself. Thanks Amazon for having it shipped quickly. Your the best!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Odor free and convenient
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this countertop compost container for a couple of months and it has been perfect for our needs. No odors whatsoever - as long as you leave the top on. :-) It's nice looking and since it's convenient to have on the counter, we're much more likely to our compostable waste in it rather than throwing it away. The only down side is the cost, but it's a good quality unit and very functional so we feel that it's been a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Rolf G Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this compost pail. Have had it for quite awhile and it is used daily. Looks good on the counter and cleans easily. Would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Jameson

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for kitchen compost
customer_reviews.text: Durable, good looking. Larger size means fewer trips to the wormbox ;^)
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice for Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I had a bamboo 1 gallon compost for my counter and it started to fall apart so I began searching Amazon for a replacement. I was a little worried about the size of this one because it is 1 1/2 gallons. I am so happy that I ordered this one because it is very solid and looks good on my counter. It is shorter and wider than my old bamboo one. It is very sturdy and I know it will last a long time. So happy I have this one!
customer_reviews.author: C. Burrell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is the perfect size for our family of 3 and does ot take up any more room on the counter than a large coffee can!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Measells

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your nose happy
customer_reviews.text: Sits proudly on our kitchen counter. Love the air purifier pad inside the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Needed this size and it has a handle....just what I hoped it would be. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: MEG in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: This item has been in heavy use in my kitchen since 2007. I have hauled kitchen scraps out to the chickens in it almost daily for over nine years. I have to tighten the knobs that hold the handle in place from time to time. Other than that, it is completely trouble free, and basically looks like new. $50 seems a little steep for a compost bucket, but it does actually contain the odors, and prevents outbreaks of fruit flies. It has never dented or scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Gustav

customer_reviews.title: Great all around
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for about a year. It still looks great with no signs of wear or rust. It stores about a week's worth of scraps. It's worth the extra expense over some of the smaller ones as it requires that many fewer trips to the compost pile. We've never had any issue with flies or odor.
customer_reviews.author: ALEX K

customer_reviews.title: Compost pail
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the pail constantly since its arrival, no smell, no bugs, easy emptying and cleaning. Looking forward to using the compost next Spring.
customer_reviews.author: Gmnellie

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but not big enough for her
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my sister. Nice quality, but not big enough for her.
customer_reviews.author: snakes444

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, easy to clean. As described and delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: rolf

customer_reviews.title: quality item
customer_reviews.text: for years i have been using a covered plastic pail to store kitchen scraps and housed it under the sink. this pail is much bigger than the one i was using, much more attractive (not that it matters. i still keep it under the sink), and really does help with the smell. i am quite pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: caradee

customer_reviews.title: Great size for a kitchen compost
customer_reviews.text: After our ceramic compost container broke, we decided to switch to stainless steel. We are very happy with this style, especially the double filters as we are getting less mold inside. The larger size is also very helpful, I can peel apples for a pie and veggies for dinner and it's still not full. The only disappointment is the cleaning of it. It didn't get as clean as I would like in the dishwasher. With a good scrub occasionally, it still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Roach Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had gotten it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. It fits great under the sink and stores much. I only have to empty it to the outside compost bin 1-2 times a week. There is no smell due to the filters in the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Composter
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking compost pail. It contains the odor better than the stainless bowl I was using. You still need to empty twice a week to keep fruit flys and smell away.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaSnavely

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compost pail. After looking at others on Amazon, I decided to go with this one based on other reviews. I have never had a problem with any odors coming from the pail, I mean absolutely none. The filter works nicely and overall I am happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: V. Correll

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This pail met all of my requirements for a compost container. It looks great on my counter. The only negative thing I can say is that I was surprised how big it was. A little taller than I had expected. Otherwise the quality is great and it cleans up nice.
customer_reviews.author: Old House in Frenchtown

customer_reviews.title: Compost Pail
customer_reviews.text: I love this compost pail. It looks good on the counter, my kitchen scraps slide out of it easily into my outside composting bin. The filters make it odorless. The stainless steel won't break if I drop it on my granite counter top. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mary B. Purves

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome product! Have been using it now for several ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product! Have been using it now for several months (it sits right on the counter). Love the big opening for scraping things into it. Good durable product.. and looks nice too!! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: still a bit smelly
customer_reviews.text: Before I had this pail, I just used an open bowl for the kitchen waste. This is definately more decorative and for the most part less smelly. However, my waste tends to stay in the pail longer and being enclosed it produces much more mold and smell inside the pail. I have noticed that the charcoal filter itself becomes quite stinky only after a few weeks. I think you are going to have to replace the filter much more often than recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I used a ceramic pot for years, and when it finally broke, I bought this one. It's easier to clean, inside and out, and the filters make any odor non-existent. I'm very happy with my new compost pot, and I don't think it will be breaking any time in the near future...
customer_reviews.author: G. Gadow

customer_reviews.title: It was great... until it had holes.
customer_reviews.text: This thing rusted holes within 5 months of use! Despite weekly emptying and cleaning, it now springs leaks. I thought this thing was stainless steel. Dang.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great compost bucket!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with compost buckets in my house and was always used to them being smelly and hard to clean out. This one is just the opposite. I have never had it smell and it is very easy to clean. I would recommend this to anyone interested in composting.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Kluemper

customer_reviews.title: RSVP Compost Pail
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied in RSVP Compost Pail. The metal is excellent. It is large eough to carry kitchen scraps for several days. It is attractive one in the kitchen. It is very easy to clean the pail. Very happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Louise Casias

customer_reviews.title: Great Pail, Excellent Size!
customer_reviews.text: I eat a vegan diet and this pail holds all of my fruit and vegetable trimmings for a week with no problems. I once pushed it to two weeks and still had no problems. The pail is easy to clean and the filters are easy to remove for cleaning and/or replacement. The pail fits beneath my kitchen sink and has freed up the space in my refrigerator that used to hold my plastic bag of trimmings.
customer_reviews.author: delecie

customer_reviews.title: It's a beauty!
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy & looks much nicer on our counter than the old cottage cheese containers we were using! Plus the bail makes it much easier to haul to the compost pile & dump.
customer_reviews.author: RR Kate

customer_reviews.title: No smell, no fruit flies!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and holds a large quanity. I love that there are no flies or smell Looks nice on the counter too.
customer_reviews.author: SPenn

customer_reviews.title: Great Pail
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compost pail. It holds a good amount of scraps so that makes for fewer trips to the compost pile. The carbon filters work great at keeping the smells away. It looks great on the counter too!
customer_reviews.author: Dalveer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very attractive compost pail, but more important it is so easy to clean and truly does not allow odors. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: aditieve

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for composting, small enough for the kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen  Pumphrey-Gore

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Keeps smell in container. Large enough to hold scraps for several days. Seems sturdy enough to last. We are happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looks great
customer_reviews.text: my wife and I loved it. Our son and his wife loved it so much that we ordered them one
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pickering

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: You can't kill this pail. It works real well, it is not too big. Use the degradable bags to help keep clean
customer_reviews.author: Deebabe57

customer_reviews.title: Counter Top Composter
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this as a Christmas gift for my son and his wife. They are avid 'composters' and I know they will love this product. And the best part is it will look nice on their counter top.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ostertag

customer_reviews.title: Handy for counter top use
customer_reviews.text: I admit it, I think composting is gross. But since my city offers it, I'm trying to do the right thing. I wanted a small compost pail to put on my kitchen counter, but so many out there are ugly and unsightly. This matches my appliances and doesn't scream "I'M A COMPOST PAIL." I notice absolutely no smell escaping even when stuff has been in there over a week. Just don't put in eggshells or it'll stink. I use the small Biobags and find it helpful to tie off the excess bag so it doesn't slip when placing and removing the cover. I like that it's stainless steel so it's easy to clean and doesn't hold on to odors.
customer_reviews.author: deal hunter

customer_reviews.title: good to have
customer_reviews.text: adds a nice look to my kitchen, handy and functional, no odors, kind of important living in the south my home is air conditioned but the kitchen is always warmer from cooking etc. in any event I use a shopping bag to line then dump in my compost barrel on the side of the house. my plan at the food scraps decompose. is to use in the yard to re-enrich my nutrient poor soil.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Ferko

customer_reviews.title: 18/8 STAINLESS STEEL: THE REAL DEAL
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite happy with this pail: it's very solid with the 18/8 stamped clearly on the bottom. I can see where the handle screws, located on the interior of the pail, might become a problem in the future by loosening, and that they could have built the pail without screws, but for now: no problems. I don't know why other reviewers are blaming the pail for fruit flies: blame the weather or geographical location, but not the pail. I haven't had any problems and I keep the lid firmly in place when I'm not dumping stuff into it--and I live in a very hot, humid climate.
customer_reviews.author: alltatup

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and looms pretty too!
customer_reviews.text: Good product. No smell from scraps I accumulate over many days. And it looks pretty. Very nice solution for accumulating scraps to compost.
customer_reviews.author: Buyergirl101

customer_reviews.title: nice size, but the lid doesn't fit tightly
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pail that was attractive enough to sit on the counter but large enough to reduce the trips to the compost bin (I have the compostumbler...highly recommended). I had a ceramic pail before but found it too small and heavy, and a hassle to clean. This one works well, and would get 5 stars were it not for the fact that the lid doesn't seal. I don't know if that's a design problem or if I just got a bad one, but it's a problem because it allows tiny fruit flies to get in. But I haven't seen another one this size, so I'll stick with it.
customer_reviews.author: J Bone

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, is just the right size, and is not going to break like my ceramic one did everytime I dropped the lid on the tile counter. I do use the compostable bags inside, and still wash out the bucket with each bag change due to leakage of fluid from coffee grounds into the bucket and wanting to keep it clean and shiny. The charcoal filters work very well for odor control. Have not used through the summer yet so time will tell if there are issues or not with fruit flies as some people have stated. Would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Stainless cleans nice, lid keeps odor down
customer_reviews.text: We've had our compost pail 10 years now and I'm just getting around to writing a review. We've used it everyday and overall I don't have any complaints. It cleans up nicely and the odor with the charcoal filters works well. The handle has finally come loose, but that isn't really a big problem. One minor issue is the lip of the lid can get kind of nasty, perhaps an arched setup would work better. Still, you can clean that, so it's not a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: It will outlast me
customer_reviews.text: I have been composting for years. Several years ago my daughter gave me a pail like this from a high end vendor and it has been great. Recently, decided I needed a second for another location. Was unsure if this one was the same but decided to order and see. It was exactly the same! It is great quality stainless, not thin walled, has two filters ( which I just wash every few months),no problem with fruit flies, lid fits good and it looks really classy on the countertop.By the way,the first one still looks as good as the new one ! I find no fault with it at all. Just love it !!
customer_reviews.author: sp

customer_reviews.title: Good product, I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: This bucket is really big. We compost a lot from our kitchen and family of five. I prob only empty it once a week into the worm bin. It only gets fruit flies if you shift the inner liner so it makes a gap. But if you line it up right, no flies. Good product, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Californialove

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done & looks nice doing it
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little bucket! After almost two months of use there is nothing I would change about the RSVP Compost Pail. No problem with fruit flies or stink so far; I empty it once or twice a week, rinse it out and let it air-dry before I put the lid back on. We generally keep it under the sink but it looks nice enough to leave out on the counter. My in-laws have had one for almost a year and love it too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Best cute compost bucket
customer_reviews.text: Best cute compost bucket! Rinses and cleans easily. Holds a good amount of food (we were annoyed with how little our old containers would hold), doesn't smell, and looks nice on our counter.
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Just right (For me anyway)
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great for me. I had the smaller version that i bought thinking it would take up less space, but this one is much better. The smaller one was getting filled to quickly and the mouth was too narrow to scrape a plate or cutting board into. This one is just right.
customer_reviews.author: John Tyler

customer_reviews.title: A little more pricey. A lot more quality.
customer_reviews.text: We've composted for years and have gone through multiple containers. This one is attractive, a good size, and is expected to last many, many, years.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, we selected the RSVP Compost Pail. It is very good. The construction is of good quality stainless. The pail is attractive on the counter top and has no smell. It really does hold almost a weeks worth of material. We did purchase the RSVP biodegradable bags, and they also make emptying and cleaning the pail a snap (however the bags are expensive). They are approximately 1 gallon bags designed to fit the pail, while the less expensive ones I found only came in 3 gallon size. To me size matters (in this case ;}.
customer_reviews.author: Otis Stelly

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Compost pail
customer_reviews.text: I like this pail better than my first ceramic one which did crack and break. It is a half gallon larger and has a better filter system meaning it has two filters in the lid. There is no odor even after several days of accumulation of banana peels,coffee grounds, and other typed of foods/greens. Excellent pail.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket

customer_reviews.title: High Quality durable pail
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement item. The first large pail had a paint finish and did not last. Rust set in quickly. It is part of a built in kitchen island and is a bit smaller but otherwise is a vast improvement. I suspect it will last a long time and look nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Ohsweethome

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Pail!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this compost bucket to replace a ceramic one that had been glued and re-glued together umteen times. My family likes this one much better; it doesn't break or smell, and has plenty of room. It looks nicer than the cheapie plastic ones - winner!
customer_reviews.author: Shellie Sims Welch

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this! There is no odor when the top is on. It is very, very easy to clean. We have had it for several months and I have not had to change the filter. It comes with an extra filter.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. W.

customer_reviews.title: no more odor or mess in our kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have container for our kitchen compost until we get it into our compost pile out of doors. There is no odor, it is easy to clean and looks better on our counter than our previous container. I like this a whole lot.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea M. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great compost pail
customer_reviews.text: It's big; big enough that we only have to empty it every few days (and we use a lot of fresh fruits and vegetables. No odor, and very easy to rinse/clean.
customer_reviews.author: Layla Davis

customer_reviews.title: years ago and it still looks like new and I use every day
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the same brand, it is the exact one, years ago and it still looks like new and I use every day. Some times I forget to dump into my composer and things are pretty rank, but the two filters in the lid keeps the smells from escaping. I bought this one for my friend, again same one, and she loves it also. In our eyes it's a winner!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gala

customer_reviews.title: Very practical
customer_reviews.text: This compost pail holds 2-3 days worth of scraps from our kitchen. I love that it is stainless steel. It's easy to clean and does not hold odors. The lid has filters included, so no odors escape. It's simple, attractive, and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Christy H.

customer_reviews.title: cleanable!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty on the counter, cleans easily and stays quiet on the scent front. Very importantly: unbreakable! Sure it dents, but it won't shatter like those ceramic ones do - or mine did anyway.
customer_reviews.author: TwoGalsGo

customer_reviews.title: Others were way too small for our family of five ...
customer_reviews.text: Others were way too small for our family of five. This size is just right and looks attractive in our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect compost pail. Looks great on the counter and does the job. Haven't had the same problem with fruit flies as others but I don't let it sit in the pail for long....yuck lol
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good size and easy to keep clean - the disposable/compostable bags really help the composting process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best compost bucket we've ever had and I've been looking ...
customer_reviews.text: Best compost bucket we've ever had and I've been looking for one that is big enough for years. This one lasts days!
customer_reviews.author: TOTSUKA

customer_reviews.title: Great countertop compost pail
customer_reviews.text: Good looking compost pail that does an excellent job of containing odors. Easy to access lid. The only thing it needs is an easy to empty plastic container inside so the stainless steel exterior doesn't get banged up. I found a large plastic candy container fit it perfectly. Expensive but looks good and very durable. Replacement carbon filters are included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: I had become accustom to having a bowl of scraps sit on my kitchen for several days before taking it out to the compost pile. This is a clean, stylish accent to my kitchen. I love it and would buy it again. Probably will for that matter as I think it is a great gift for friends who garden!
customer_reviews.author: Judith B

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product Makes Composting Easy
customer_reviews.text: I've had a composting bucket like this for years and loved it. The charcoal filter in the lid works really well, and it looks handsome next to the kitchen sink. It really makes collecting kitchen scraps for compost easy. I bought this latest one to give my dad as a present. He loves it, too. The "fit and finish" is not nearly as good as on my old one -- too bad -- but it's still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mckee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot of scraps, washes well in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Lighter Weight and Less Breakable than Porcelain Pails
customer_reviews.text: This compost pail serves its purpose. I like that it is lighter weight than the porcelain compost pails and that is also not so breakable.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality, heavy duty compost pail. It can be taken to the compost bin and be banged on its side to empty it without being damaged. It is a large size and can hold a lot of scraps before needing to be emptied. The charcoal filter in the lid controls odors and it comes with a spare filter.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Compost Pail even looks Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this compost pail . . . it holds an abundance of uneaten food with no smell (thanks to the charcoal filter), it adds to my "greenness", and it looks good too!
customer_reviews.author: B. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Best compost pail we've have
customer_reviews.text: This is extremely sturdy and large. The steel is thick, so I don't think it will rust through like our last one. Not only is it large capacity, but the mouth is large, which reduces spillage when scraping in food scraps. The lid is so easy to use. Others have complained about its not fitting tightly, but I always hated trying to cram a lid closed. It slides on easily and fairly quietly, and we have not had an odor issue. This is the most we've ever spent on a compost pail, but I think it's going to last forever! Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: CNY Doc

customer_reviews.title: way better than plastice
customer_reviews.text: this product is so much better than the plastic snap top kitchen compost pail that came with my composter. the filters keep the odor under control. we originally did not get the biodegradeable bags, but taking the pail out to the composter in the snow was not a good scene. cleans easily. bags are a good option and cheap enough to get.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Looks and functions great
customer_reviews.text: I bought the compost pail several years ago, it stays on my counter for all the veggie and fruit scraps. Keep summer fruit flies down and odor to a minimum. I wait till it's full before bringing it to the outside composter. Sometimes it sits for several days and still it does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Annexen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what I want. It's the right size, the lid fits well, it cleans easily, and there's no smell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for myself and one for a gift. It holds several days of waste yet remains odorless. Great addition to my kitchen. I plan to order another for a wedding gift this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R. Lewis

product_meta.title: RSVP International XL Compost Pail, 1.5 Gallon, Multi Color
product_meta.description: Size:1.5 GallonRsvp strives to offer quality kitchen products and cooking tools at competitive prices. This compost pail is a perfect example. Keep your kitchen tidy all the time with this endurance 1-1/2-gallon compost pail. With it's ability to hold a generous amount of vegetable and food scraps you will able to relax with only a few trips to the compost bin. This pail is complete with a polished stainless steel outside look and sturdy bail handles that make it very easy to carry. This pail also comes equipped with two charcoal filters in the vented lid in order to maintain an odor-free environment. With this pail you will be on your way to making recycling trouble-free and convenient for you. Made of durable 18/8 stainless steel (polished body, brushed lid). Measures 9-1/2-inches in diameter by 10-inches tall (with lid on on). when all the right people, and ingredients, kitchen tools, and food come together, we call this the art of gathering.
feature_bullets: Made of durable 18/8 stainless steel (polished body, brushed lid)
Lid has 2 charcoal filters for odor control, includes extra set of filters
Measures 9-1/2-inches in diameter by 10-inches tall (with lid on on)
